intro: Hoya ferrerasii, commonly known as the "Coral Hoya," is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its waxy, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that often bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions. Hoya ferrerasii is a trailing plant that can be grown as a houseplant or in hanging baskets. Its unique appearance and relatively easy care make it a popular choice among plant enthusiasts.
